Text.Value: I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared

Text.Value: I couldn't stay in the grove with the others - just waiting to die. So I left.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

Text.Value: Please, oh, please.

EditorData.NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

Text.Value: Joking aside, thank you. You won't regret this - I promise.

EditorData.NodeContext: delighted, over the moon to be joining

Text.Value: It's you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player moves out of combat ready stance
EditorData.NodeContext: unhappy to see player

Text.Value: How in the Hells did you get here?
First you convince me to quit being a bard, then you threaten to kill me? Charming as ever.

EditorData.NodeContext: sacrastic and bitter

Text.Value: ...Fine. Goodnight.

EditorData.NodeContext: player is being a dick to her - telling her to sleep by the toilet. She agrees, upset and bitter.

Text.Value: You can stay for the night, but I want you gone by morning.
Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.
Where are you headed?
Let her stay if you want. But if that bard breaks out in song, I'm not having it.
Waterdeep... Neverwinter. I don't know. The farther the better.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad - just wants to get away

Text.Value: All right, I'm going!

EditorData.NodeContext: player has readied themselves to attack her. Hands up - as if warding the player away - scared and shocked.

Text.Value: I won't let you down - I promise.

EditorData.NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

Text.Value: Sleep by the latrine, and don't say a word to me.
Remind me who you are, again?
You can stay - for now. Let's see how you fare.
But I can fight! I won't hold you back, I swear it.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and passionate

Text.Value: I saw your fire and I hoped for a safe place to rest...

EditorData.NodeContext: feeling a bit awkward - she doesn't want to be here but she desperately needs somewhere to rest (player will have the option to let her stay after this line)

Text.Value: What's that supposed to mean?
Alfira! What are you doing out here?
Look, I did as you said - I quit being a bard. You were right - I wasn't any good. But it... left me in a bad way.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

Text.Value: Get out. Now.
Why don't you join me? I'll keep you safe.
All right... all right. I'll find someone else. I'm sure.
It's pure luck I got this far. I'm, well, exhausted.

EditorData.NodeContext: exhausted and drained

Text.Value: I'm so glad I found - wait, it's me!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE*[PLAYER] from CINE_Ground_Idle_01_LOOP, stands up and turns, startled. end with Combat Attitude. <CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.
EditorData.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

Text.Value: I'm sorry for barging in like this, but I had to come find you.
Leave. Now.
You can stay then night, but then you leave. Alone.
All right, all right! I just... I was sure you would help.

EditorData.NodeContext: gutted, sad

Text.Value: Hah. I know who you are - how could I not? You're all anyone in the grove talks about.

EditorData.NodeContext: small laugh at the beginning as player has introduced themselves. She's travelled all this way just to find them.

Text.Value: Oh, yes! Everything is fine - thanks to you.

EditorData.NodeContext: touched the player was worried

Text.Value: She seeks a safe haven. What sort of earsgang would refuse it?

EditorData.NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole.

Text.Value: Argh. This is the last thing I need. Look - you left me... in a bad way.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to regin in her emotions and just give the facts

Text.Value: You've, well, inspired me. I want to stand on my own two feet, to prove that I can be half the bard Lihala was.

EditorData.NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

Text.Value: Unfortunately, I'm exhausted. If I take you to the grove now, I'll get lost - I know it.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad, frustrated with herself

Text.Value: That's why I'm here. When I'd heard what you'd done - it inspired me. Made me feel brave again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

Text.Value: Look, after you broke my lute, I was... in a bad way.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

Text.Value: Unless I hide away from the world, I can't avoid it. So I'd rather face it head on - with you.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and passionate

Text.Value: I thought you many things, but cruel? That's a first.

EditorData.NodeContext: disgusted by player - she asked for help and been turned away very cruelly

Text.Value: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.
We have room at the campfire yet - let the girl stay. I wouldn't want it said that I am any less than a perfect gentleman.
I need your help! I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared, player is on the verge of attacking her

Text.Value: Look, I'm here because I saw your fire and hoped for a safe place to rest. Would you mind if I stayed her tonight?

EditorData.NodeContext: clearly exchuated, today has been a lot.

Text.Value: I'm not going to say it's fine, because it's not. But thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has apologised and while alfira isn't ready to accept it, she really appreciates it. A small step towards rebuilding her trust.

Text.Value: You've, well, inspired me. I want to stand on my own two feet, to prove that I can be half the bard my teacher was.

EditorData.NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

Text.Value: Really? I don't know.

EditorData.NodeContext: hesitant, looking away

Text.Value: Give me one reason not to kill you right now.
I just wanted to hear you beg a little - you can join me.
It means I did as you said - I quit being a bard. I wasn't any good, remember?

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter and angry

Text.Value: That would only be the second-worst thing you've done to me - you lute breaking arsehole.

EditorData.NodeContext: temper flares

Text.Value: True. But I'm a bard, remember? I want to do more than sing about other people's adventures.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and passionate

Text.Value: Wonderful! The more, the merrier.
Ready yourself to attack.
Goodnight, and thank you. I mean it.

EditorData.NodeContext: small tired smile - she finally sees hope

Text.Value: I'm only here out of necessity. I saw your fire in the dark, and I'm, well, exhausted. I need somewhere safe to rest.

EditorData.NodeContext: business-like - just wants to sleep, leave, and never set eyes on the player again

Text.Value: Safer to keep her here than blundering around by herself - wouldn't want her accidentally leading the wrong sort of attention to us.
Is something wrong? Are the tieflings all right?
Sorry, I don't mean to sound ungrateful, I'm just exhausted. Why don't we talk about it in the morning?

EditorData.NodeContext: catches herself - appreciates the offer but doesn't have the energy to think about it much

Text.Value: Very good! Break out that lute, bard - I'm in the mood for a song.
Let me stay the night, and I'll take you to the grove in the morning. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: impassioned please

Text.Value: You managed to sneak through enemy grounds - you'd be useful in the party.
If the gods have any sense of justice, we won't meet again.
*Her voice is steady - her gaze unflinching. She's telling the truth.*
You know what it means, you lute-breaking arsehole.

EditorData.NodeContext: temper flares

Text.Value: Give me one reason not to kill you.
Grab a bedroll or leave.
You? No - I don't think you will.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has asked her to join them, alfira has zero time for this.

Text.Value: Let her stay if you want. But if that bard breaks out in song, I'm not having it.
I don't have the energy for this. I'm going to bed. Don't worry - I'll be gone by first light.

EditorData.NodeContext: exhausted - cold.

Text.Value: Really? Oh, I'm so relieved. Everyone is going to be so happy to see you - I know it!

EditorData.NodeContext: grateful, sincere, relieved

Text.Value: You managed to sneak through the goblin camp - you'll be very useful.
Don't. Just don't.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has tried to apologise and alfira has ZERO time for it

Text.Value: I'm Alfira - a bard from the grove. I don't mean any harm!

EditorData.NodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player doesn't hurt her. Sincerely trying to prove who she is (in this scenario, player and alfira haven't met.

Text.Value: I'm so glad I found - wait!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE*[PLAYER] from CINE_Ground_Idle_01_LOOP, stands up and turns, startled. end with Combat Attitude. <CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.
EditorData.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found a camp (her and the player have never met) Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

Text.Value: Wait - wait! I'm not your enemy, quite the opposite, in fact!

EditorData.NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

Text.Value: Thank you. Goodnight.

EditorData.NodeContext: reliebed she can stay. Plans to leave in the morning and never speak to the player again.

Text.Value: Yes! Thank you - you won't regret it!

EditorData.NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

Text.Value: Leave - now.
It's Alfira from the grove!

EditorData.NodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player recognises her

Text.Value: Goodbye.
I'll grab a few winks, and then I'll lead you there first thing in the morning. Thank you - I'm glad I found you.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to rally herself and make a plan

Text.Value: And if that doesn't work, well, we'll need protection on the road.
Gods, this is the last thing I need.

EditorData.NodeContext: looking away, trying not to get upset. The player is the person she was trying to get away from.

Text.Value: Why did I bother trying to explain myself? I've met steaming piles of excrement more pleasant than you.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter and angry

Text.Value: Gods. You really are a bastard, you know that?

EditorData.NodeContext: furious as she turns to leave

Text.Value: Goodnight - I guess.
I'd be careful, little waif, we don't all play nicely.
Really? Oh, this is wonderful!

EditorData.NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

Text.Value: Oh. We met in the grove? I heard what you did - how much you helped us.

EditorData.NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it. Sincere in second half

Text.Value: What exactly do you want me to do?
Hah! Then well played, because I was moments away from getting on my knees.

EditorData.NodeContext: joking back with the player - big smile

Text.Value: She seeks a safe haven. What sort of earsgang would refuse it?

EditorData.NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole

Text.Value: The druids are threatening to kick us out, but goblins swarm the roads. If we leave, we're dead. If we stay, we're dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared

Text.Value: You may join me - I'd love to have you.
What are you doing in the middle of the goblin camp? It's very dangerous.
I should kill you for barging in here.
But it... doesn't sound like such a bad idea. Goodnight, and thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: small gentle smile, hinting that alfira could potentially join the player in the morning (she doesn't, cause the player kills her, but still)

Text.Value: Fine.
Ease your worries, warm your hands. We owe you that much.
I'm so glad I found - wait!

EditorData.AnimationTags: *REUSE*[PLAYER] from CINE_Ground_Idle_01_LOOP, stands up and turns, startled. end with Combat Attitude. <CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.
EditorData.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.
EditorData.logicalname: Did grove but didn't meet alfira

Text.Value: I've been running since Elturel - and when we finally arrived in the grove, we found danger there, too.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and passionate

Text.Value: Fine - I'll help.
No - I have no time for weaklings.
Whoa - whoa! I'm here because of you!

EditorData.NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

Text.Value: She may not be much of an asset, but I doubt she'll be a hindrance. Let her stay.
Tell me about the grove.
All right...

EditorData.NodeContext: player has refused to let her stay - aboslutely gutted

Text.Value: My services come at a price - give me everything you have.
Mm. Just keep it quiet, hear?
Goodnight and... thank you for letting me stay.

EditorData.NodeContext: but still, because she's lovely, feels the need to say thank you. Very begrudging thank you.

Text.Value: Oh, come on, let her stay - we have room to spare.
But my friends, all of us, we'll die without help!

EditorData.NodeContext: scared, impassioned plea

Text.Value: So you ran like a coward? Good to know.
I want to join you - to fight by your side. I want to help people - as you've helped me.

EditorData.NodeContext: strong, determined, passionate

Text.Value: Please, stay your blade! I mean no - oh.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [PLAYER] from CINE_Ground_Idle_01_LOOP, stands up and turns, startled. end with Combat Attitude. <CodyM>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.
EditorData.NodeContext: She's lost in the dark and just walked into what she thinks is a stranger's camp - looking for shelter. The 'oh' is because she recognises the player.

Text.Value: Things between us and the druids are tense. If you could mediate - maybe convince them to let us stay, that would be a big help.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared, just trying to think of anything to help her friends

Text.Value: My name is Alfira - I'm a bard. I mean no harm!

EditorData.NodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player doesn't hurt her. Sincerely trying to prove who she is (in this scenario, player and alfira haven't met.

Text.Value: I'm sorry. I just saw your fire and ran towards it. I need your help.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared

Text.Value: Are you sure? I lead a dangerous life.
Because I need help - desperately.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared

Text.Value: That much of a fool, you got lost in the goblin camp?
Alfira! How did you find your way here? It's very dangerous.
Oh. We met in the grove? You helped me finish my song - the Weeping Dawn?

EditorData.NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it.

Text.Value: Oh don't be such a killjoy. What's the worst that could happen?
It's safer for you at the grove.
Don't sneak up on people like that.
Not a problem.

EditorData.NodeContext: cold, distant

Text.Value: You wandered through the goblin camp? You must really want to meet me.
Sure - I'm happy to help.
What are you doing here? It's dangerous.
I'm sorry for upsetting you.
I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Nice to meet you.
State your purpose, or die.
As long as she doesn't start serenading me. I've had enough of bad poets singing of my looks.
Stay out of my way and be gone in the morning.
Alfira? Why are you here?
I don't care - get out.
Really? Just like that? All right, but if she reaches for that lute, it's firewood.
Please - it's dark and I'm... I'm afraid. Just one night - I beg of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

Text.Value: I want to make my own stories. And I can't think of anyone else I'd rather share that with.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and passionate

Text.Value: I want to join you - to fight by your side. I want to help people, as you've helped us.

EditorData.NodeContext: strong, determined, passionate

Text.Value: I changed my mind - get out. Now.
Fine.
You're all anyone talks about in the grove. Hearing all you've done inspired me.

EditorData.NodeContext: impassioned, sincere

Text.Value: I'll be gone by first light. Good night.

EditorData.NodeContext: small voice, sad

Text.Value: Really? Just like that? Oh, thank you - thank you so much.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

Text.Value: You can clearly handle yourself in a fight. And we, well, we're not exactly warriors.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad and scared

Text.Value: But... fine. Here. That's all I have.

EditorData.NodeContext: player has asked for money. Sad, but willing. This is her life savings

Synopsis:
In this scene, Alfira arrives unannounced at the player's camp. Depending on the grove, she either 1) asks the player if she can join their camp 2) be mad at the player for upsetting her in the grove and ask to spend the night (she got lost and needs shelter) or 3) if the player has missed the grove will ask the player to come help her friends the tieflings.
In all instances, when the player and Alfira go to sleep, the player will awaken to find blood on their hands and Alfira's dead body next to her. They will have killed Alfira in their sleep. This is a scene specific to the Dark Urge custom origin.
